title: Product Manager – Crushing Digital & Automation
description:
Do you enjoy shaping digital and automation offerings that make complex industrial operations smarter, safer, and more efficient?  

Step into a highly strategic position where your decisions directly influence how digital and automation solutions deliver real customer value. This is an exciting opportunity to take full ownership of a growing and complex product portfolio and to work at the intersection of technology, business strategy, and customer outcomes.
About the job
As Product Manager for Crushing Digital & Automation, you’re the accountable owner of the portfolio vision and direction. The role defines what is built, why it’s built, and when it’s prioritized across automation systems, digital services, and platform-enabled offerings. By understanding our customer needs, you translate business strategy into clear portfolio priorities, lifecycle decisions, and value realization. You report to the Product Line Manager – Digital, Service & Automation.
What you’ll do* Lead discovery efforts by focusing on high‑value customer and business needs.
* Translate insights into clear value propositions, success criteria, and portfolio‑level requirements.
* Build roadmaps and align stakeholders, major scope decisions, and lifecycle actions such as invest, scale, optimize, or retire.
* Ensure offerings are launch‑ready, measurable, and supported across sales, service, and operations.
* Collaborate closely with product owners, UX, and subject matter experts on execution and delivery.
* Track portfolio health using adoption, value creation, revenue, and customer outcome metrics.
* Act as the voice of the product – collecting feedback from the markets and integrating the portfolio in the global sales and service organizations.


Location and flexibility
The role is based in Svedala. We offer a hybrid work setup, and international travel will occur.
Your profile
You have several years of experience working with product portfolios or multiple related products, preferably industrial, engineered, or hardware‑enabled. Practical experience at the intersection of automation, software, and digital services is advantageous, along with the ability to connect technical solutions with commercial and customer value. You have strong business judgment when making prioritization and trade‑off decisions. A university degree in a relevant field or equivalent experience is needed, and you communicate fluently in English, written and spoken.
You have a collaborative, outcome-driven mindset and build trust across global, cross‑functional teams. You navigate complex stakeholder landscapes with confidence, take accountability without formal authority, and create alignment while maintaining clear decision ownership. With curiosity and structure, you balance short-term customer needs with long-term portfolio impact.
Our culture
At Sandvik, we’re tech driven, innovative and entrepreneurial. We believe that success is a team effort so we value diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive culture where people can be themselves and reach their full potential. So, we invest in supporting each other, learning together and celebrating our differences. Visit our stories hub, LinkedIn or Facebook to get to know us further.
Contact information
For further information about this position, please contact Louise Hitchcock, hiring manager, louise.hitchcock@sandvik.com
We’ve already decided on which advertising channels and marketing campaigns we wish to use and respectfully decline any additional contacts in that matter.
Union contacts – Sweden* Mårten Lindberg, Unionen, +46 (0)76 111 03 36
* Jonny Hansson, Akademikerföreningen, +46 (0)76 126 45 81
* Michael Wicktor-Ohlsson, Ledarna, +46 (0)70 251 44 57


Recruitment Specialist: Anton Karlsson
How to apply
Send your application no later than February 9, 2026. Click apply and include your resume and cover letter in English. Please note that we don’t accept applications by e-mail. Job ID: R0086880.
To learn more about our recruitment process, please visit our career site or contact HR Services at hrservices.sweden@sandvik.com*Rock Processing is a business area within the Sandvik Group and a leading supplier of equipment, tools, parts, service and solutions for processing rock and minerals in the mining and infrastructure industries. Application areas include crushing and screening, breaking and demolition. In 2024, sales were approximately 11 billion SEK with about 2,700 employees.*

Box 510, SE-101 30 Stockholm, Sweden

title: Solution Architect
description:
Transport is at the core of modern society. Imagine using your expertise to shape sustainable transport and infrastructure solutions for the future. If you seek to make a difference on a global scale, working with next-gen technologies and the sharpest collaborative teams, then we could be a perfect match.

**What you will do**
--------------------


As a Global Solution Architect, you will be part of VFS which, in partnership with the Volvo Group brands, is facilitating the development of common Services platforms that are supporting Volvo Group’s expansion.  

Designing solutions compliant with the CAST model (Common Architecture, Shared Technology) allows VFS to create scalable, cost-effective global solutions while giving Volvo Group brands the ability to deliver high value to their customers and employees.


You will also provide guidance and ensure adherence to best practices, standards, and target architecture as per the VFS Design Authority process.


As an IT solution architect, you will work in a cross-functional team to understand the project/product scope, objectives, and business value. You will engage with external vendors to evaluate COTS (Commercial Off-The-Shelf) solutions to define which solutions are in line with our long-term technology roadmap and business strategy.  

You will collaborate with UI/UX designers, front-end and back-end developers, and QA engineers to ensure the quality and performance of IT solutions is top-notch.

 **Your future team**  

You will report directly to the Global Solution Architecture Chapter Lead within VFS D&IT and will be assigned to a stable, global cross-functional team. Digital and IT is the engine of the VFS business, and we continue our strategic journey to further improve performance and to deliver the best customer experience in the industry. In this exciting environment, we are focused on Digital Innovation to meet the demands of our customers in an increasingly digitalized world.


In many of our markets, VFS has won the Great Place to Work award, where Great Work is done. By interacting with each other as an on-site business, we build relationships, which allow us to work together more efficiently and form stronger bonds with our colleagues and customers. The preferred location is Gothenburg, Sweden.

**Who are you?**
----------------


Do you dream big? We do too, and we are excited to grow together. In this role, we believe it is the right mindset that will make a difference at VFS. If you, besides your genuine interest in working with people in Transforming Together, also have a positive, service-oriented, and collaborative mindset, and take a proactive approach to handling all responsibilities, idea generation, and recommendations for productivity and efficiency - then we would welcome you to apply for this role.


We believe the successful candidate has the passion and excitement to take on this challenge.

**Qualifications likely required to be successful in this role include:**

* A bachelor’s degree in computer science, software engineering, or a related field.
* Open minded and creative thinker to address complex challenges (using Design Thinking).
* Excellent communication, collaboration, and problem-solving skills. English fluency is mandatory.
* Acting as a mentor, providing technical guidance to development/stable teams.
* Automotive and/or financial banking industry experience is good to have.
* Enterprise Azure Architecture (Senior Level)


5+ years designing enterprise-scale solutions on Microsoft Azure, including multi-region deployments, high availability and disaster recovery, identity and access management, networking, and security controls.  

Deep understanding of Azure services, including computing, storage, networking, databases, security, DevOps, and AI.  

* Integration & API Architecture


Strong experience in designing and governing APIs and integrations using REST, event-driven, and asynchronous patterns, with hands-on knowledge of Azure Integration Services (Service Bus, Event Grid, Logic Apps, Azure Functions).  

* Cloud-Native Application Design


Proven ability to architect cloud-native solutions using microservices, containers (AKS), serverless architectures, and API gateways, applying scalability, performance, and reliability best practices.  

* DevOps & Automation


Experience with CI/CD pipelines, Infrastructure as Code (Bicep, ARM, or Terraform), and observability/monitoring to ensure solutions are reliable, secure, and operable in production.  

* Security, Compliance & Architecture Governance


Experience designing secure, compliant solutions in regulated environments (financial services preferred), working within formal architecture governance models and applying security-by-design and zero-trust principles.  

* Certifications (Good to have)


AZ-104: Microsoft Certified: Azure Administrator Associate  

AZ-400: Designing and Implementing Microsoft DevOps Solutions  

AZ-500: Microsoft Azure Security Technologies**Ready for the next move?**
----------------------------


If you want to make a real impact in your career, Volvo Financial Services is where you want to be.


We value your data privacy and therefore do not accept applications via mail.

 **Who we are and what we believe in**  

We are committed to shaping the future landscape of efficient, safe, and sustainable transport solutions. Fulfilling our mission creates countless career opportunities for talents across the group’s leading brands and entities.

  

Applying to this job offers you the opportunity to join **Volvo Group**. Every day, you will be working with some of the sharpest and most creative brains in our field to be able to leave our society in better shape for the next generation. We are passionate about what we do, and we thrive on teamwork. We are almost 100,000 people united around the world by a culture of care, inclusiveness, and empowerment.

  

At **Volvo Financial Services**, we are working together to shape the world we want to live in. As the captive finance arm of the Volvo Group, VFS provides financial services and solutions that meet the needs of our customers’ evolving business. Through our dedication to innovation, we support society in its adoption of sustainable transport and equipment solutions. VFS is headquartered inGothenburg, Sweden, and serves Volvo Group customers and dealers in more than 50 markets.

**What’s in it for you?**


We offer a solid and competitive package of compensation and benefits, plus you will enjoy a diverse working environment with a culture of care and inclusion. As an investment, we support your personal development and growth to achieve your career aspirations. Volvo Financial Services is an on-site business and we understand that you might need occasional or temporary flexibility, which your leader is equipped to manage and fits well to our culture, as being together enables us to build upon our innovative and collaborative culture, as well as develop you for continued success.
company_description: Every day, we work with some of the sharpest and most creative brains in our field to leave our society in better shape for the next generation.

title: Digital Designer
description:
SF Anytime söker en kreativ, nyfiken och idéstark Digital Designer som vill vara med och utveckla och förstärka det visuella uttrycket för SF Anytime och Blockbuster i alla digitala kanaler. Du kommer att spela en central roll i att skapa inspirerande och engagerande innehåll som får fler att upptäcka vår värld av film och serier.
 


  


**Om rollen** 



  


 I den här rollen arbetar du främst med rörligt material och digitalt uttryck – från animationer och motion graphics, till videoformat för sociala medier, kampanjer och Marketing Automation-flöden. Du blir en viktig del av vårt sälj- och kreativa team, där du samarbetar tätt med performance marketing, kampanjkreatörer, utvecklare och externa partners.
 


  


**Dina ansvarsområden** 



  

* Skapa engagerande rörligt och visuellt material för kampanjer, sociala medier, Marketing Automation och webb.
* Utveckla och vårda den visuella identiteten för SF Anytime & Blockbuster i alla digitala kanaler.
* Producera material självständigt utifrån brief och koncept – från idé till färdig leverans – anpassat för rätt kanal, format och målgrupp.
* Säkerställa en enhetlig visuell kommunikation i samarbete med interna team och externa partners som filmbolag och kreativa byråer.
* Bidra med kreativa idéer och designinsikter i kampanjplanering och projekt.
* Anpassa och optimera innehåll för performance marketing och konvertering.


  

  

**Kvalifikationer**

**Vi söker dig som** 



  

* Har en relevant utbildning, och minst två års erfarenhet inom digital design eller motsvarande.
* Har erfarenhet av att arbeta med starka kommersiella varumärken.
* Har ett skarpt öga för detaljer, visuell kvalitet och varumärkesidentitet.
* Är nyfiken, drivande och trivs i ett kreativt team där mycket händer.
* Förstår hur innehåll anpassas för olika digitala plattformar – från sociala medier till banners och kommersiella ytor.
* Kan optimera kreativa assets för performance och konvertering.
* Talar och skriver obehindrat på svenska.
* Har stort intresse för film, serier och digitalt berättande.


  


 Dessutom ser vi gärna att du behärskar:
 


  

* Adobe Creative Suite (After Effects, Premiere Pro, Photoshop, Illustrator & InDesign)
* Cinema 4D
* Figma
* Det är även meriterande om du har erfarenhet av 3D-arbete, ljud-design eller andra typer av kreativa färdigheter.


  


**Om SF Anytime:** 



  


 SF Anytime, som är en del av SF Studios, är en ledande video-on-demand-tjänst i Norden och Baltikum. Vi erbjuder tusentals filmer och serier – från de senaste Hollywoodpremiärerna till lokala nordiska titlar – både direkt till konsumenter och genom partnerskap med operatörer. Efter förvärvet av Blockbuster Danmark fortsätter vi att växa och integrera våra tjänster mellan marknader. På SF Anytime kommer du att arbeta med engagerade kollegor inom innehåll, marknadsföring, e-handel och produkt. Vi är ett samarbetsinriktat team som drivs av en gemensam passion för underhållning och en riktigt bra kundupplevelse.

title: Webbredaktör
description:
På TRR satsar vi på kommunikation som gör skillnad – för människor i förändring och för ett varumärke med ett viktigt samhällsuppdrag. Nu söker vi en webbredaktör som vill vara med och utveckla vår externa webb och bidra till tydlig, användarvänlig och effektiv digital kommunikation.
   

  

 Som webbredaktör hos oss tar du ett redaktionellt ansvar för webbens innehåll och arbetar nära kollegor inom kommunikation och tvärfunktionellt inom utveckling. Du kombinerar ett starkt innehållshantverk med ett datadrivet arbetssätt och bidrar till att höja kvaliteten i TRRs digitala närvaro.
   

  

**I ditt jobb ingår att:**
* Skriva, redigera, publicera och paketera informativa, engagerande och användarvänliga texter för webb i CMS samt vid behov bidra med textproduktion och anpassning av innehåll för sociala medier, där webben är primär kanal.
* Optimera och vidareutveckla webbens innehåll utifrån användarbeteenden, data och verksamhetens behov.
* Föreslå och genomföra innehållsförbättringar för ökad läsbarhet, tydlighet och konvertering, inklusive test av copy och rubriker.
* Följa upp och analysera webbens innehåll med stöd av statistik och analysverktyg, exempelvis Google Analytics, för att identifiera behov av utveckling.
* Säkerställa att innehållet följer varumärkesriktlinjer, tonalitet, tillgänglighetskrav samt UX- och designprinciper.
* Arbeta tvärfunktionellt tillsammans med digital kommunikationsstrateg samt exempelvis UX, design och utveckling.


**Hos oss får du:**
* En specialistroll i ett engagerat kommunikationsteam där webben är en prioriterad kanal.
* Möjlighet att arbeta användarnära och insiktsdrivet med innehåll som ska vara lätt att förstå, hitta och använda.
* Ett professionellt sammanhang med höga kvalitetskrav och fokus på kontinuerlig utveckling.
* En öppen och dynamisk arbetsmiljö där vi lär oss och utvecklas tillsammans.
* Bidra till ett samhällsuppdrag med stor relevans.


**Vi strävar alltid efter mångfald.** 
 För oss innebär det att olikheter berikar och stärker vår verksamhet. Vi välkomnar sökande med olika bakgrunder, erfarenheter och perspektiv.
   

  

**Vi söker dig som har:**
* Erfarenhet av arbete som webbredaktör eller i liknande roll, med mycket god förmåga att skriva och strukturera innehåll för webb.
* Dokumenterad vana av CMS, gärna Optimizely, samt grundläggande kunskap om bild- och videoadaptering för digital publicering.
* Praktisk erfarenhet av SEO och innehållsoptimering samt förståelse för AEO.
* Förmåga att arbeta insiktsdrivet med analysverktyg och att tillämpa WCAG i publicering.
* Vana av att arbeta i en utvecklingsnära kontext där agila arbetssätt tillämpas.
* Mycket goda språkkunskaper i svenska, med särskilt stark förmåga i skrift.


 För den här rollen värdesätter vi dokumenterad praktisk erfarenhet och förmåga framför formell högre utbildning.
   

  

**Sista ansökningsdag:** 
 Välkommen att ansöka senast den 9 februari. Vi går igenom ansökningar löpande och annonsen kan därför komma att stängas innan sista ansökningsdag.
   

  

**Omfattning:** 
 Heltid/Tillsvidare
   

  

**Start:** 
 Omgående med hänsyn till uppsägningstid
   

  

**Placeringsort:** 
 Stockholm
   

  

**TRR arbetar för tjänstemän och arbetsgivare inom det privata näringslivet.** 
 Vi är specialister på omställning och kompetensstöd. I våra drygt 30 000 anslutna företag arbetar drygt 1,1 miljoner tjänstemän. Genom olika tjänster och rådgivning vägleder vi företag och deras medarbetare till ny anställning, studier eller att starta eget företag.

title: Senior Product Designer - Platform Design
description:
The Platform Design team is on a mission to fuel innovation through design. We don’t just build tools: we shape world-class ecosystems and craft high-impact solutions that empower organizations to thrive in an increasingly complex digital world.
   

  

 As part of our Shipping Our Expertise (SOE) team, you will be at the forefront of a major strategic shift at Spotify. This is an incredibly exciting space where we productize the "Spotify way" of working into a catalog of emerging SaaS products. We are building the future of how some of the most renowned software development companies in the world, from industry giants to agile startups, operate, collaborate, and scale.
   

  

 This role is a unique hybrid, bridging the gap between deep Product UX, Brand identity, and Product Marketing. You will not only apply our build systems but actively compose the visual language and user experience for the future catalog of software shipping from Spotify. It’s about creating a new professional standard for software used by diverse customer types worldwide, including cross-functional partnerships, R&D teams, company managers, and operational functions.
   

  

 What You'll Do
   

  

* Frame complex problem spaces and define the design strategy for our emerging SaaS catalog, exploring multiple solutions before landing on a high-conviction recommendation.
* Own the design quality and cohesion of sophisticated user journeys, ensuring our product UX and visual language are consistent, seamless, inspiring, and world-class.
* Contribute to and evolve a design system that supports a growing catalog of external-facing products, balancing existing Spotify paradigms with fresh, innovative visual instincts.
* Craft intuitive experiences for a wide range of customer types, from executive decision-makers to technical specialists, ensuring our software solves sophisticated organizational challenges.
* Expertly represent the design field in product rituals and high-stakes collaborator forums, including studio-wide All Hands.
* Leverage AI-assisted workflows and tools to expedite idea generation and rapid prototyping, enabling faster iteration while maintaining a high bar for craft, clarity, and human-centered outcomes.
* Partner with Product, Engineering, and Data Science at the highest levels to co-create strategic direction and challenge the team's understanding of the problem space.
* Empower and mentor other designers, fostering a culture of high-caliber design strategy and execution.


 Who You Are
   

  

* You possess incredible aesthetic taste and instincts, "sweating the details" of visual design while remaining grounded in functional, high-utility product UX.
* You understand how to take the core energy of the Spotify brand and refine it into a professional SaaS context that feels Alive, Human, and Meaningful.
* You have a proven track record partnering cross-functionally in a complex product environment, such as scaled tech companies, platforms, or leading agencies.
* You have experience in product marketing and are proficient with content management systems (ideally Webflow or similar) to bring brand stories and product value-propositions to life.
* You approach projects with a comprehensive mentality, proven to deliver solutions that simplify complex workflows for diverse user groups.
* You excel at sharing critical information across teams and can back up your ideas with clear rationale and data-driven insights.
* You are committed to continuous growth, adapting seamlessly to the fast-paced shifts of the global SaaS landscape.


 Where You'll Be
   

  

* This role is based in London (UK) or Stockholm (Sweden).
* We offer you the flexibility to work where you work best! There will be some in person meetings, but still allows for flexibility to work from home.


 Spotify is an equal opportunity employer. You are welcome at Spotify for who you are, no matter where you come from, what you look like, or what’s playing in your headphones. Our platform is for everyone, and so is our workplace. The more voices we have represented and amplified in our business, the more we will all thrive, contribute, and be forward-thinking! So bring us your personal experience, your perspectives, and your background. It’s in our differences that we will find the power to keep revolutionizing the way the world listens.
   

  

 At Spotify, we are passionate about inclusivity and making sure our entire recruitment process is accessible to everyone. We have ways to request reasonable accommodations during the interview process and help assist in what you need. If you need accommodations at any stage of the application or interview process, please let us know - we’re here to support you in any way we can.
   

  

 Spotify transformed music listening forever when we launched in 2008. Our mission is to unlock the potential of human creativity by giving a million creative artists the opportunity to live off their art and billions of fans the chance to enjoy and be passionate about these creators. Everything we do is driven by our love for music and podcasting. Today, we are the world’s most popular audio streaming subscription service.

title: UI/UX Design Manager - AI Powered (Relocation to Dubai)
description:
**Position:** 
 AI-First UI/UX Design Manager
 



**Compensation:** 
 AED 25,000 - AED 35,000 per month + Up to 10% Performance Bonus
 



**Total Annual Package:** 
 Up to AED 480,200 (Tax-Free)
 



**The Reality:** 



* Dubai = 0% personal income tax. Your offer is your take-home.
* In most major markets, 30-50% goes to taxes. Here, 100% of what we offer is what you keep.



**Location:** 
 Dubai, UAE (On-site) with relocation assistance and visa support
 



  





**Role Overview** 




 We're seeking an innovative AI-First UI/UX Design Manager to join our dynamic team at the forefront of internal innovation.
 



  





 You'll report directly to the CEO and hold ultimate ownership of our e-commerce web design, revolutionizing our design process and customer experience through the integration of artificial intelligence while transforming the design team's creative process through AI-driven workflows.
 



  





**The Career Accelerator** 




 You'll compress 3 years of AI-first design leadership mastery into 1. You'll ship high-fidelity web experiences and conversion experiments in your first year. You'll transform how an entire design team works—implementing AI-powered creative operations that eliminate bottlenecks, cutting design to dev handoff time by 40% while rapidly exploring layouts and variants through Figma AI and Firefly, and mentoring your team through a fundamental technological shift that most design leaders won't navigate for years. This pace energises impatient high-performers. It exhausts clock-watchers. If you get frustrated when you're not learning fast enough, you'll thrive here.
 



  





**What Is In It For You:** 




 This isn't just another design leadership role. This is your chance to become a true industry architect.
 



  





**1. Pioneer the Future of AI-Driven Design** 




 You won't just use AI tools—you'll architect an entirely new design operating system. You'll build prompt libraries, AI-assisted workflows, and quality frameworks that eliminate bottlenecks and cut handoff time by 40%. You'll design for conversational shopping, semantic search, and AI assistants while your peers are still debating whether to adopt Figma AI. This is your sandbox to experiment with bandit allocation, LLM-powered recommendations, and Gen AI content operations at scale. You'll master the balance between AI velocity and human craft that most designers won't understand for years.
 



  





**2. Join the Elite Organization and Partner with the 1%:** 



* 🏆 Top 5 Mattress Brand in US with Over
 **$1 Billion USD** 
 in Sales
* 🌍 Great Place to Work Certified
* 💡 Work with Forbes Council Member CEO
* Gain firsthand exposure to strategic decisions and high-velocity execution that drives a global brand



  





**3. Experience a World-Class Lifestyle** 




 Dubai offers a tax-free income that translates to significantly higher take-home pay compared to most global markets. Enjoy a cosmopolitan environment with world-class infrastructure, year-round sunshine, and a thriving international community of 14+ nationalities. This role includes relocation support, premium health coverage, and annual flights home—all while building your career in one of the world's most dynamic business hubs.
 



  





**4. Own the Conversion Engine** 




 You'll have direct P&L impact with clear metrics: add-to-cart conversion lifts, experiment velocity, and design system adoption. You'll present quarterly roadmap reviews directly to the CEO, translating design decisions into business narratives that shape company strategy. This isn't design as decoration—it's design as a revenue driver with full executive visibility and accountability.
 



  





**What You'll Need:** 



* 7–10 years in web design for e-commerce, including 4+ years leading, mentoring, and managing the operations of a design team
* A portfolio that shows shipped PDP/PLP/Checkout improvements tied to clear business metrics
* Expert in Figma (components, variables, Dev Mode); strong visual/motion craft and responsive design sensibility
* Proven experience implementing GenAI tools into a professional design pipeline, with a clear understanding of prompt engineering, quality control, and brand governance
* Familiarity with AI-shaped UX patterns: conversational search, assistant UI, recommendation modules, and their measurement
* Comfort collaborating on experiments (A/B vs multi-armed bandits) with Growth; understands trade-offs between optimization speed and causal certainty
* Working knowledge of WCAG 2.2 and SEO fundamentals for structured content and schema on e-commerce sites



  





**Good-to-Have:** 



* Experience designing chat or guided-selling flows



  





**The Puffy DNA** 




 We're restless, perpetually hungry, and fast-paced, driven by an unwavering belief that we can outperform any competitor — regardless of their size.
 


* **Be the Owner:** 
 We don't hire employees; we welcome owners. You're accountable for results, not activity.
* **Execute with Urgency:** 
 We thrive in high-stakes environments by making thoughtful decisions quickly and acting decisively.
* **Demand Excellence:** 
 We solve the hard problems that others can't, pushing the boundaries of our craft.
* **Be AI-First:** 
 Daily multi-turn AI conversations challenge your assumptions.
* **Go All-In:** 
 When the mission demands it, we rally as one team to cross the finish line.



  





**✨ Your Total Compensation & Benefits** 




  





**💰 Compensation:** 



* Monthly performance bonuses (up to 10%)
* Tax-free income
* Annual return flight allowance to your home country
* Parking allowance (up to AED 7,800 annually)



  





 🏆
 **Rewards & Recognition:** 



* The Leaders Club: Opportunity for selection to an elite lifestyle transforming recognition program featuring premium wellness memberships, exclusive professional networking events, and annual leadership retreats
* 'We Are' Champion: Monthly recognition program with gift vouchers and company-wide celebration for exceptional contributions



  





**🏥 Health & Protection:** 



* Premium worldwide health coverage (AED 1Million limit)
* Life insurance & Personal Accident Insurance (24x monthly salary)



  





**🌴 Time Off:** 



* 22 working days annual leave + UAE public holidays



  





**🌍 Relocation Support (International Hires):** 



* UAE work visa sponsorship
* International flights & airport transfers
* 14-day 4-star hotel accommodation



  





**💼 Work Environment:** 



* AI First organization with access to AI-native tool stack
* Premium office environment in Dubai Internet City
* Learning & development opportunities
* International team collaboration (14+ nationalities)



  





**✅ Other Benefits:** 



* End of Service Gratuity per UAE law



  





**Ready to Shape Your Story?** 




 Click "Apply" and take the first step.

title: Product Manager
description:
At Tive, we imagine a fully-transparent world in which everything and everyone is connected. We innovate beyond what the world thought possible—so what people hold near and dear arrives on time and in full.
   

  

 We believe (and live!) four core values:
   

  

* Transparency First: We make everything visible so that everyone can operate better
* Always strive to make things simpler
* We are One Team, we have each other's backs
* Relentless iteration to optimize and improve


 Whether shipped by road, rail, ocean, or air, Tive reduces shipment delays, minimizes rejected loads, and decreases theft, damage, and spoilage. Our customers count on Tive to ensure that their shipments are delivered on time and in full—because every shipment matters.
   

  

 As the Product Manager for mobile experiences, you will own and evolve our mobile product—used daily by drivers, logistics operators, and frontline teams across the supply chain. You’ll be responsible for defining strategy, driving execution, and delivering intuitive, reliable mobile products that operate in high-stakes, real-world environments.
   

  

**Our Ideal Candidate Must Have**
* Bachelor's degree. Business, engineering, computer science, or related fields preferred.
* 5+ total years of work experience and 3+ years of product management experience
* Self-starter with a proactive attitude and ability to thrive in a dynamic, entrepreneurial environment
* Proven track record of successfully shipping products and driving business results
* Strong analytical skills with the ability to use data to inform decision-making


****Nice to Have****
* Experience delivering successful mobile experiences
* Experience delivering successful B2B products
* Previous experience at a high growth technology startup


**What You’ll Be Doing**
* Own the mobile product strategy and roadmap, aligned to company and customer outcomes
* Own the success and execution of initiatives, from concept to launch, including prioritizing features, creating product requirements, and coordinating release plans.
* Translate complex logistics workflows into simple, intuitive mobile experiences
* Maintain an exceptional product quality bar through deep collaboration during product development and ownership of launch decisions at the end of the process.
* Conduct user research with drivers, warehouse teams, and operations leaders to deeply understand real-world constraints (connectivity, safety, time pressure)
* Define clear requirements, success metrics, and tradeoffs for mobile initiatives
* Manage execution across iOS and Android, including feature parity, performance, and reliability
* Balance near-term delivery with long-term mobile platform investments
* Communicate progress, decisions, and learnings to stakeholders across the company


**Need To Know Info**
* To support effective collaboration, candidates must be located in time zones closely aligned with CET (within two hours).


****What does Tive offer?****
* A chance to join what may very well turn out to be the most important company in your career.
* The autonomy and resources to build what you know how to build.
* Work with a committed global team that have each others back.
* Hybrid in Norway and remote work options, depending on location.
* Competitive equity to ensure all of our employees have a sense of ownership in the long-term success of Tive’s growth.


**We celebrate diversity, and consider it key to our success as both a team and a company. We are proud to be an equal-opportunity employer, and we are committed to creating an inclusive environment of mutual respect for all employees.**

title: Product Manager for Marshall Headphones
description:
Marshall Group is the audio, tech, and design powerhouse uniting musicians and music lovers through genre-breaking innovation. Our flagship brand, Marshall, is uniquely positioned with over 60 years of rock ‘n’ roll attitude on stage, at home, and on the go. Our iconic products are brought to life by a dedicated team of 800 passionate employees and sold in over 90 markets worldwide.
   

  

**Right now,** 
 we need to strengthen our Product Management team with a Product Manager for Marshall Headphones who will focus on shaping the long-term roadmap and turning user insights into products people love.
   

  

**What you’ll do:**
 As Product Manager for Marshall headphones, you will help shape the future of our headphone category, from the earliest ambition and concept stage to the launch and through the lifecycle. You will turn insights into products users love, define long-term direction, and collaborate closely with design, tech, and commercial teams. Your work will ensure that our headphones continue to deliver meaningful experiences to people around the world.
   

  

**Roles & Responsibilities:**
* Secure strong product–market fit by balancing user desirability, business viability, and technical feasibility.
* Analyse user feedback and market insights to build a deep understanding of consumer behaviours and trends.
* Define discovery hypotheses and explore opportunities together with tech and design leads.
* Develop and communicate product vision, strategy, and roadmap, including business case and long-term ambitions.
* Guide and align the product team around shared objectives and priorities.
* Collaborate with Brand, Marketing, and Sales teams in go-to-market activities.
* Ensure efficient product portfolio and lifecycle management.
* Monitor user experience and business performance of products on the market.
* Drive development with a focus on both product impact and business outcomes.
* Anchor prioritisation, direction, and decisions across cross-functional teams and stakeholders.


**Who we’re looking for:**
 In this role, you shape the long-term roadmap for Marshall’s headphone category and drive development with engineering, design, and commercial teams. You communicate clearly, collaborate well, and create structure in complex situations, with curiosity and inclusivity at the core. You report to the Director of Product Management and work closely with the Product Management team at HQ. We’re looking for a thoughtful, collaborative product person who turns insights into real solutions and makes balanced decisions.
   

  

**You probably have the following experiences & skills:**
* Several years of experience as a Product Manager or in a similar role.
* Background in Consumer Electronics or hardware products.
* Bachelor’s or master’s degree in engineering or a related field.
* Hands-on experience with product development.
* Experience managing product portfolios and lifecycles.
* Skilled in analysing market data, trends, consumer insights, and user needs to shape product strategy.
* Strong interest in tech trends and solid technical understanding.


**Our pledge:**
 We thrive to foster an inclusive workplace and we do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, disability, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age or marital status. We firmly believe that Marshall thrives when our employees do, leading to better experiences for our consumers.
   

  

 We encourage applications from all over the world. To enable transitioning from another country for a role at Marshall, we offer re-location support. This support is tailored for each role but always includes visa/work permit application, local authority registration, and home finding service. Don't hesitate to reach out if you have any questions.
   

  

**Does this sound like you?**
 We look forward to reviewing your application!

title: Test Engineer
description:
Marketnode is Asia-Pacific’s trusted blockchain-powered financial market infrastructure (FMI) backed by HSBC, SGX Group and Temasek. We believe in the power of programmable assets and believe traditional financial instruments can be originated, traded and served better leveraging blockchain technologies. Our current product focus is funds, credit and structured products with a view to expand these offerings in-line with market demands.
   

  

 Having recently closed our Series A investment with major financial institutions such as HSBC, Marketnode is now well positioned for it’s next growth phase and is looking for a Test Engineer leading overall delivery efforts for our platform and data services offerings.
   

  

 The role is responsible for planning, designing, executing, and maintaining test activities to ensure product quality across functional and integrated systems.
   

  

 This role involves collaborating closely with developers, business analysts, and other QA team members to identify issues early, improve test coverage, and contribute to continuous improvement of testing processes and automation practices.
   

  

 If you are passionate about and interested in the nexus between fintech and capital markets, we would like to talk to you.
 **The role is based in India and reports to the Lead QA Engineer.**
**Key Responsibilities**
* user stories, requirements, and design documents to define comprehensive test scenarios.
* Design, develop, and execute manual and automated test cases for functional, regression, and integration testing.
* Develop and maintain automation scripts (Selenium, Cypress, Playwright, etc.).
* Perform API and integration testing.
* Identify, document, and track bugs using issue tracking tools.
* Collaborate with developers and product teams to ensure timely bug resolution.
* Support non-functional testing (e.g., performance, security, usability) as required
* Contribute to QA process improvements and maintain test documentation, including test plans, test strategy updates, and test reports.


**Qualifications**
* Experience:3+ years of experience in engineering / software quality assurance, with 2+ in automation.
* Have domain knowledge for Blockchain or Digital Asset
* Technical Skills:Skilled in at least one programming/scripting language (Java, JavaScript, etc.).
* Knowledge of CI/CD tools, bug tracking systems, and QA methodologies.
* Detail-oriented, analytical, and proactive
* Education:Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field, or equivalent experience.

title: Manual QA Engineer
description:
At Ubiquiti Inc., we create technology platforms for Businesses, Smart Homes, and Internet Service Providers, driven by our goal to connect everyone, everywhere by Rethinking IT. To date, Ubiquiti has shipped over 100 million devices worldwide, from ISP networking products to next generation of IT solutions. At Ubiquiti, you’ll heighten your potential and broaden your horizons, while shaping the future of connectivity.
   

  

**We are looking for a highly skilled Manual QA Engineer for our team in Stockholm, Sweden.**
***Please note that applicants must live in Sweden and hold a valid work permit at the time of application to be considered for this role.***
**Responsibilities**
* Preparing test scenarios, test plans, test procedures, and test reports for various projects such as Design Center/InnerSpace, Accounts or Community
* Manual testing as well as automation testing for both UX/UI and functionality of the developed software/application to make sure requirements are met or exceeded
* Collaborating with a team consisting of PM, developers and designers


**Requirements**
* At least 5 years of experience in a QA role
* Thorough understanding of QA methodology and best practices
* Hands-on experience in writing and executing test cases and test plans
* Passionate about ensuring great UX for the customers/users of the product you work on
* Excellent communication skills and highly proficient in English (written and spoken)


**Nice to have:**
* Experience with web test automation
* Experienced in scripting languages (e.g. JavaScript / TypeScript)
* Experience with Continuous Integration tools (e.g. Jenkins/AWS Code Pipeline)


**Benefits**
* Competitive compensation
* Occupational pension, health insurance, private health insurance, life insurance and work-injury insurance, and wellness allowance (5000 SEK)
* Flexible work hours and a hybrid work model
* Access to all the latest Ubiquiti products for home use


***Please note that a background check will be conducted in the final stage of the recruitment process***

title: Marketing Manager (Maternity Leave Cover)
description:
**Introduction**
 At Gallagher, we help clients face risk with confidence because we believe that when businesses are protected, they’re free to grow, lead, and innovate. You’ll be backed by our digital ecosystem: a client-centric suite of consulting tools making it easier for you to meet your clients where they want to be met. Advanced data and analytics providing a comprehensive overview of the risk landscape is at your fingertips. Here, you’re not just improving clients' risk profiles, you’re building trust. You’ll find a culture grounded in teamwork, guided by integrity, and fueled by a shared commitment to do the right thing. We value curiosity, celebrate new ideas, and empower you to take ownership of your career while making a meaningful impact for the businesses we serve. If you’re ready to bring your unique perspective to a place where your work truly matters; think of Gallagher.
   

  

**Overview**
 Gallagher is looking for a seasoned marketing professional (maternity cover). The role is placed in Sweden and includes varied marketing responsibilities across the Nordic region.
   

  

**How You'll Make An Impact**
 In this role you will service the Nordic business and implement tactics in the market to help build the Gallagher brand and support business growth. You will be working closely with local stakeholders, backed by a global marketing team serving as a full-service in-house agency.
   

  

 Your responsibilities include:
   

  

* Running Gallagher’s Nordic marketing channels, including website, social media, marketing automation and PR
* Delivering campaigns and activities with measurable results
* Partnering with in-house creative, digital and media teams to plan and execute marketing campaigns
* Producing written content in Swedish, and providing translation of central content from English to Swedish
* Supporting local activation of events and exhibitions
* Working with senior stakeholders to devise and follow up marketing plan and budgets


**About You**
* Relevant marketing/business degree preferred
* Proven B2B marketing experience, including
+ Delivering end to end marketing campaigns
+ Ability to develop, implement and follow up marketing plans
+ Communicating with and reporting back to senior stakeholders

* Fluency and excellent communication skills (oral and written) in both English and Swedish languages.
* A strong self-starter with ability to work autonomously while also collaborating with remote team
* Strong interpersonal skills and ability to communicate effectively with all levels management
* Strong project management and planning skills and ability to anticipate future outcomes
* A proactive and solution-oriented mindset, with the ability to handle multiple tasks at once.


**What We Offer**
* A positive and inclusive work environment, with engaged and friendly colleagues that are dedicated to delivering results while having fun at work.
* Personal development through exciting and challenging assignments and the opportunity to learn from leading marketing experts across SEO/SEM, social media, content, web & UX, branding, graphic design, and copywriting
* Several attractive employment benefits, including fixed salary, health care and employee insurance.


**Type of employment**
* Full-time, temporary employment from May 2026 to September 2027.

title: IT-tekniker
description:
**Om arbetsplatsen**
--------------------



Välkommen till oss på Hammarö!
  

  

Hammarö är en kommun med framåtanda och stark tillväxt som ligger vid Vänern omgiven av klippor och vatten. Många väljer att flytta till oss vilket gör att vi ständigt växer och utvecklas. Något som speglar allt som sker i vår kommun är närheten till staden, invånarna, vattnet och till varandra. Hos oss får du en arbetsplats mitt i vår vackra skärgård!
  

  

Inom kommunstyrelsen arbetar du nära de beslut som fattas i kommunen. Genom att se till helheten och vart vi är på väg arbetar vi med allt som kan tänkas beröra kommunens invånare och anställda. Det är vi som arbetar bakom kulisserna och håller ihop den röda tråden som leder kommunen i rätt riktning in i framtiden.


**Arbetsuppgifter**
-------------------


Som IT-tekniker är dina arbetsuppgifter varierande men består i huvudsak av slutanvändarsupport i vår IT-support. Det innebär att ge användarhjälp både på distans och ute i verksamheten, felsökning, ta fram guider mm. Du får även medverka i utveckling av IT-infrastruktur och tjänster. Du tillhör IT-enheten som jobbar för alla förvaltningar och bolag inom Hammarö kommun.
  

  

IT-enheten består av 15 personer inkluderande Hammarö Stadsnät med arbetsplatsen förlagd på Sätterstrand. Tillsättning sker enligt överenskommelse.


**Kvalifikationer**
-------------------


Krav på arbetlivserfarenhet: Ingen erfarenhet krävs. Vi söker dig med:
  

* Gymnasial utbildning med inriktning teknik eller IT.
* Mycket goda datorkunskaper.
* Goda kunskaper i Windows 11.
* Goda kunskaper i felsökning av mobila enheter.
* Serviceinriktad personlighet.
* God kommunikationsförmåga.
* Goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska i tal och skrift.
* B-körkort.

  

Det är meriterande med eftergymnasial utbildning inom IT och vi ser gärna att du har tidigare erfarenhet av arbete med IT-support.
  

  

Som person är du öppen, drivande och ansvarstagande. Du har god samarbetsförmåga och en vilja att ge god service. Vi fäster stor vikt vid personlig lämplighet och söker dig som bidrar till ett gott arbetsklimat genom god kommunikation och samarbete.
  

  

Provanställning kan förekomma.  

**Anställningens omfattning**
-----------------------------


Anställningsform: Tillsvidareanställning  

Omfattning: Heltid  

Varaktighet: Tillsvidare  

Antal platser: 1

  

**Andra uppgifter**
-------------------


För att kvalitetssäkra rekryteringsprocessen i Hammarö kommun samt möjliggöra god kommunikation med våra sökande ber vi dig skicka in din ansökan digitalt och inte via e-post eller pappersformat.
  

  

Varmt välkommen med din ansökan!
  

  

Inför rekryteringsarbetet har Hammarö kommun tagit ställning till rekryteringskanaler och marknadsföring. Vi undanbeder oss därför bestämt kontakt med mediesäljare, rekryteringssajter och liknande.

  

**Ansökan**
-----------


Sista ansökningsdag: 2026-02-20  

Arbetsgivarens referensnummer: C302144  

  



  

**Upplysningar**
----------------


Lena Norén  

IT- och digitaliseringschef  

054-51 54 19  

lena.noren@hammaro.se  

  

Nås via kommunens Kontaktcenter  

054-51 50 00 (vxl)

title: IT-tekniker
description:
Publicerad: 26 januari 2026
Vill du vara med och bidra till en modern, effektiv och säker digital arbetsplats och ge de som arbetar i Malmö stad en användarupplevelse i toppklass?



Supportenheten Malmö stads IT- och digitaliseringsavdelning söker IT-tekniker med placering i vår servicedesk. Verksamheten levererar en litlig och tillgänglig IT-support till samtliga anställda i Malmö stad. Som en del av vårt team är du med och bidrar till en smidig och effektiv IT-miljö för våra kolleger i staden.



1st-line är den första kontakten med IT- och digitaliseringsavdelningen och ditt professionella bemötande och din högklassiga service bidrar till kundens upplevelse av hela organisationen. Rollen är en viktig del i att bygga förtroende för vår IT-support, och underlätta i den digitala vardagen för medarbetare i Malmö stad. Rollen ska säkerställa att varje kontakt upplevs som hjälpsam, trygg och effektiv.


**Arbetsuppgifter**
-------------------


* Besvara inkommande ärende med ett trevligt och serviceinriktat bemötande.
* Registrera, kategorisera, prioritera och dokumentera tydligt och korrekt i vårt ärendehanteringssystem.
* Ärenden som inte avslutas i 1st-line ska eskaleras till 2nd-line och ska innehålla tydlig och nödvändig dokumentation för vidare hantering.

Säkerställa att kunden informeras om ärendets hantering* ett lösningsfokuserat och pedagogiskt sätt med högkvalitativ kundservice för att möta Malmö stads förväntningar.

**Kvalifikationer**
-------------------


**Krav**


* Relevant högskole- eller YH-utbildning alternativt annan utbildning med teknisk inriktning i kombination med erfarenhet som arbetsgivaren bedömer likvärdig.
* Tidigare arbetslivserfarenhet av kundsupport i minst 6 månader.
* God administrativ vana.
* God förståelse för den digitala arbetsplatsen och har förmåga att lösa IT-relaterade problem samt ett stort intresse för felsökning och åtgärd inom IT-relaterade frågor.

Obehindrad kommunikation* svenska i tal och skrift samt god förmåga i engelska tal och skrift.


**Meriterande**


* Arbetslivserfarenhet från offentlig sektor eller stora komplexa organisationer.


För oss är dina personliga förmågor och kompetenser avgörande för tjänsten så vi kommer därför lägga stor vikt vid detta. Som IT-tekniker hos oss behöver du kunna se till helheter och ta hänsyn till det större perspektivet, där du förstår din roll i verksamheten. Eftersom du kommer ha en kundsupporterande funktion är det avgörande att du trivs i en social kontext där du dessutom har förmågan att vara utåtriktad och skapa goda kontakter och relationer.



I rollen kommer du arbeta med att lösa och analysera problem vilket ställer krav att du har en god problemlösande analysförmåga. Vidare ser vi att det är av stor vikt att du är självgående genom att kunna ta ansvar för din uppgift och själv strukturera upp och driva processer vidare. Du är organiserad och har förmågan att prioritera dina uppgifter så att du håller uppsatta tidsramar. Som IT-tekniker kommer du behöva visa förståelse för människors olikheter gällande sin förmåga att ta till sig information vilket ställer krav att du kan anpassa ditt sätt att förmedla budskapet ett för mottagaren pedagogiskt sätt.


**Om arbetsplatsen**
--------------------



 Malmö stads IT-och digitaliseringsavdelning arbetar vi med människor, teknik och beteenden för att utveckla och leverera digitala lösningar. Vi är IT- & digitaliseringsproffs som med vår djupa tekniska kompetens strävar efter att förstå och möta Malmöbornas och medarbetarnas digitaliseringsbehov. Tillsammans är vi ca 120 kollegor som har ett brett uppdrag att leverera stadsgemensamma tjänster till alla verksamheter.



Vi sitter i nya moderna lokaler Kungsgatan 6 mitt i Malmö.



Vill du veta mer om vår IT- och digitaliseringsavdelning? Läs mer här: Det här är ITD - Malmö stad



Malmö stads verksamheter är organiserade i 14 förvaltningar. Vårt gemensamma uppdrag är att skapa välfärd och hållbar samhällsutveckling. Tillsammans med Malmöborna utvecklar vi en ännu bättre stad att bo, verka och vara i; olikheter, livserfarenheter och talanger gör Malmö till en smart stad i hjärtat av Europa. Världens kunskap finns här.



Läs om Malmö stad som arbetsgivare här malmo.se/jobb


**Information om tjänsten**
---------------------------



Anställningsform: Tillsvidareanställning  

Omfattning: Heltid  

Antal tjänster: 3  

Tillträde: Enligt överenskommelse  

  

Lönespannet för tjänsten ligger mellan 30 000-34 000 kr.


**Övrigt**
----------



Malmö Stad strävar efter att medarbetarna ska avspegla den mångfald som finns bland befolkningen. Vi välkomnar därför sökande som kan bidra till att vi som arbetsgivare kan tillgodose Malmöbornas behov.



Om du vill vara med att bidra till effektiv och säker digitalisering som gagnar hela staden, är du varmt välkommen med din ansökan!



För att skicka in din ansökan, klicka ansök nedan. Har du några frågor gällande tjänsten kontakta nedan nämnda kontaktpersoner.


**Om tjänsten**
---------------

20260100
