* Have full responsibility for a part of the ledger processes relevant to your strengths
* Assist with the year end audit process and statutory reporting
* Support the finance team's wider plans to prepare for an IPO
* Improve the efficiency of financial processes and procedures and monitor compliance
* Share knowledge between team members to ensure cover is available when needed
* Actively develop your own skills to ensure current knowledge of applicable standards and regulations
* Establish strong relationships with key colleagues outside the wider finance team


 What we are looking for in you
   

  

* Exceptional academic track record and subsequent career performance
* Bachelor's degree in Accounting or equivalent
* Qualified accountant (ACCA, ACA, ACMA, CPA, etc.)
* Experience at a large public accounting firm, or public multinational corporate accounting department preferred
* NetSuite or similar enterprise grade systems experience
* Willingness to travel up to four times per year


**What we offer colleagues**
 We consider geographical location, experience, and performance in shaping compensation worldwide. We revisit compensation annually (and more often for graduates and associates) to ensure we recognize outstanding performance. In addition to base pay, we offer a performance-driven annual bonus or commission. We provide all team members with additional benefits which reflect our values and ideals. We balance our programs to meet local needs and ensure fairness globally.
   

  

* Distributed work environment with twice-yearly team sprints in person
* Personal learning and development budget of USD 2,000 per year
* Annual compensation review
* Recognition rewards
* Annual holiday leave
* Maternity and paternity leave
* Team Member Assistance Program & Wellness Platform
* Opportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues
* Priority Pass and travel upgrades for long-haul company events


**About Canonical**
 Canonical is a pioneering tech firm at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open-source projects and the platform for AI, IoT, and the cloud, we are changing the world of software. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence; in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do. Most colleagues at Canonical have worked from home since our inception in 2004. Working here is a step into the future and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game.
   

  

**Canonical is an equal opportunity employer**
 We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.

title: Data Analyst (Maternity Cover - 1 year contract)
description:
**ABOUT SINCH** 




 Sinch is pioneering the way the world communicates. More than 150,000 businesses - including Google, Uber, Paypal, Visa, Tinder, and many others - rely on Sinch's Customer Communications Cloud to power engaging customer experiences through mobile messaging, voice, and email.
 



 Whether you need to verify users or craft omnichannel campaigns, Sinch makes it easy. Our AI-infused Super Network, APIs, and applications ensure you can connect with your customers reliably and securely, at every step of their journey.
 



 At Sinch we "Dream Big", "Win Together", "Keep it simple", and "Make it Happen". These values are our foundation!
 



**DESCRIPTION** 




 At Sinch, our focus is on driving growth through organic initiatives. Strong organic growth requires a solid data foundation to guide business strategy and build operational efficiency. As part of our Data Analytics department, you'll collaborate with colleagues across multiple regions and functions.
 



 The team's mission is to deliver timely, high-quality insights that support decision-making across the Sinch business, from operational optimisation to tactical and strategic recommendations. To succeed in this role, we're looking for someone who is curious about the drivers behind data patterns, detail-oriented in their execution, and comfortable working in a dynamic, fast-changing environment. You will work closely with multifunctional teams such as Product, Finance, HR, and Sales, and be part of a modern analytics setup using tools like Snowflake, dbt, and Tableau.
 



 This is a one-year fixed-term contract, covering colleagues on parental leave. The role is designed to ensure continuity in analytics delivery and stakeholder support during this period.
 



**Key Tasks and Responsibilities:** 



* Insights and Reporting: Deliver actionable insights through data analysis; maintain and develop dashboards, reports, and models to track key performance indicators and support business decisions.
* Data Model Development: Create and refine models to support our stakeholders' decision-making processes.
* Collaboration and Integration: Work closely with teams such as Product, Finance, and Data Delivery to embed analytics into ongoing business processes and initiatives.
* Continuous Improvement: Assess internal resources, documentation, data sources, and reporting continually, striving for improved quality and accuracy.
* Spreading Data Culture: Support stakeholders in understanding and using data effectively, contributing to a stronger data-driven culture across the organization.
* Analytics Support and Operations: Act as a key point of contact for internal analytics users by managing support requests, investigating data quality or reporting issues, and answering questions related to dashboards and data usage.







**REQUIREMENTS** 



* Experience in business, financial, or strategic analysis, gained through roles such as analytics, finance, modelling, consulting, audit, or similar.
* At least 2 years of experience using Tableau.
* At least 2 years of experience working with SQL, or a comparable track record in analyzing large structured and unstructured datasets.
* A bachelor's or master's degree in a quantitative or business-related field (e.g. finance, economics, mathematics, engineering, computer science) is desirable.
* Experience working with stakeholders to solve business problems using data and analytics, including translating insights into clear recommendations.
* Fluency in English, both written and spoken.



**Big Plus** 



* Experience working in a global company with colleagues and partners across the world.
* Tech, SaaS, or Telecom experience working in a Business-to-business setting.



**Preferred Qualities** 



* Growth Mindset: Encourages continuous learning and development, both personally and professionally, and views challenges as opportunities for growth.
* Detail-Oriented: Pays meticulous attention to the nuances of data and analytics, ensuring accuracy and precision in all aspects of work.
* Adaptability: Demonstrates flexibility in responding to changes in the business environment, maintaining effectiveness in varying situations.
* Emotional Intelligence: Approaches collaboration with empathy and professionalism, building positive and effective working relationships.
* Innovative Mindset: Encourages thinking outside the box and embracing new ideas and technologies, keeping us at the forefront of industry advancements.
* Effective Communication: Exhibits strong skills in expressing ideas and complex data insights clearly and persuasively to diverse audiences.



 Our corporate language is English,
 **please submit your application in English** 
 .
 



 At Sinch, we value learning, embrace change, and offer opportunities for personal and professional growth. Unfortunately, we are not supporting relocation outside the EU at this time. Applicants must:
 


* Hold Swedish or EU/EEA citizenship.
* Have a valid Swedish work permit.







**OUR HIRING PROCESS** 




 We are committed to ensuring a recruitment process that is fair, objective, consistent, and inclusive. Our approach includes structured, competency-based interviews designed to evaluate your skills, experience, and qualifications relevant to the role. At times, we may include a data-driven assessment to enhance our hiring success and identify candidates likely to excel.
 



 We believe in a two-way process and encourage you to ask questions throughout the journey. If this role isn't what you're looking for, please explore the other opportunities listed on our career page: https://www.sinch.com/careers/. No matter who you are, we hope you find an exciting path forward - hopefully with us!

title: Senior Products & Systems Engineer
description:
At Capgemini Engineering, the world leader in engineering services, we bring together a global team of engineers, scientists, and architects to help the world’s most innovative companies unleash their potential. From autonomous cars to life-saving robots, our digital and software technology experts think outside the box as they provide unique R&D and engineering services across all industries. Join us for a career full of opportunities. Where you can make a difference. Where no two days are the same.
   

  

 Capgemini is a global business and technology transformation partner, helping organizations to accelerate their dual transition to a digital and sustainable world, while creating tangible impact for enterprises and society. It is a responsible and diverse group of 340,000 team members in more than 50 countries. With its strong over 55-year heritage, Capgemini is trusted by its clients to unlock the value of technology to address the entire breadth of their business needs. It delivers end-to-end services and solutions leveraging strengths from strategy and design to engineering, all fueled by its market leading capabilities in AI, generative AI, cloud and data, combined with its deep industry expertise and partner ecosystem.

title: Senior Sales Executive (B2B SaaS)
description:
Location: 
 
**Stockholm, Borås, Norway/Denmark** 

  
 




  






 Markets: 
 
**Across the Nordics (incl. Norway & Denmark ownership)** 

  
 




  






 Reporting to: 
 
**CRO** 

  
 




  





  
 



  





**About Inretrn** 
  
 



  






 Inretrn is a 
 
**market-leading B2B SaaS solution in the Nordics** 

 , helping retail and e-commerce brands secure long-term profitability by taking control of one of the industry’s most complex and costly challenges: 
 
**returns and post-purchase operations** 

 . 
 




  






 Our platform combines 
 
**automation, freight optimization, and intelligent workflows** 

  to reduce operational costs, improve customer experience, retain revenues, and unlock new commercial opportunities. Our product is developing rapidly with the latest technology and application of AI.  
 




  






 Inretrn is trusted by leading retail brands such as 
 
**Stadium, Nelly.com, Gina Tricot, Samsøe Samsøe, NN.07, Fjällräven, Jula, Nordic Nest** 

 , and many more. 
 




  






 With a strong foundation in the Nordics, we are on a journey to 
 
**expand internationally,** 

  backed by ambitious growth targets and a clear vision to 
 
**define the category globally!** 

  
 




  






  
 




  





**The Role** 
  
 



  






 We are looking for 
 
**senior, commercially strong Sales Executives** 

  to take full ownership of new customer acquisition at Inretrn. 
 




  






 In this role you own the entire sales journey - from prospecting and first contact to negotiation, contract signing, and handover to onboarding. 
 




  






 We are hiring 
 
**senior profiles** 

 , including individuals who can take 
 
**regional ownership for Norway or Denmark** 

  as part of our continued market expansion. Partner relations is an important source for lead generation at Inretrn and is owned by the sales team.  
 




  






 You will operate with significant autonomy but also work closely with the CRO and play a key role in shaping how a future, larger sales organization will operate. This is a role that requires strong self-leadership and relentless collaboration across the whole organization for us to succeed as a team.  
 




  






  
 




  





**Your responsibilities** 
  
 



  




* Identify, prospect, and qualify new customers
* Drive complex B2B sales processes with multiple senior stakeholders
* Conduct needs analysis, product demos, and commercial business cases
* Confidently engage senior decision-makers and 
 
**discuss P&L impact for retail businesses**
* Negotiate and close commercial agreements
* Build long-term relationships with customers and partners
* Contribute to 
 
**team enablement** 

  with best practices, structure, and commercial insight as the team grows
* Ensure high structure, accuracy, and quality in CRM




  
 




  





**Who we are looking for** 
  
 



  






 Inretrn operates in 
 
**B2B SaaS sales** 

  within retail and e-commerce and we are looking for someone that has 
 




  




* a strong 
 
**network within Nordic retail**
* proven success in owning and closing multi-threaded enterprise deals
* experience in value-led enterprise selling
* has excellent cross-functional collaboration skills
* a curous mind - ready to learn all there is about post-purchase operations, logistics technology and our customers reality




  
 




  






 Relevant backgrounds: 
 




  




* Senior B2B sales of 
 
**ERP systems, SaaS products, or logistics solutions** 

 , or
* Commercial or operational leadership roles within 
 
**retail** 

 , with clear ownership of results



  






 You are confident in engaging senior decision-makers, comfortable with longer sales cycles, and 
 
**highly fluent in discussing operational efficiency, margins, and P&L drivers in retail** 

 . Like us, you focus on measurable outcomes.  
 





  
 




  





**Why join Inretrn?** 
  
 



  




* **Full ownership and significant mandate** 

  — you run your deals end-to-end
* Direct impact on company growth, revenue, and international expansion
* Close collaboration with CRO, product, and the wider organization
* Opportunity to 
 
**build, enable, and shape the future sales organization**
* Be part of a high-performing, fast-moving team on an 
 
**ambitious, aggressive growth journey**



  






 This role is for senior sales professionals who want to 
 
**build something that scales** 

 , influence strategy, and grow alongside the company.

title: Enterprise Client Acqusition Director
description:
At SPOC,
 **we’re a team of passionate professionals and curious minds dedicated** 
 to helping businesses evolve through smart, impactful ServiceNow solutions.
 



**Since 2010, we’ve been a trusted ServiceNow partner** 
 , delivering more than 300 successful projects and growing into one of Europe’s leading ServiceNow-focused consultancies.
 



  





**Briefly about what we do** 




  





 We specialise in end-to-end digital transformation — from strategic advisory to full implementation —
 **empowering organisations to automate workflows, enhance efficiency, and stay ahead in a rapidly changing world.** 




  





 At SPOC, we’re not just building a company — we’re cultivating a community driven by our core values:
 **initiative, curiosity, autonomy, and respect** 
 . We encourage bold ideas, celebrate every success, and empower our people to make a real impact.
 



  





**Your Role** 




  





 We’re looking for
 **a dynamic, results-driven Sales Hunter** 
 to spearhead our business development efforts in the
 **Nordics enterprise market.** 




  





**Preffer home location: Sweden, Stockholm** 




  





 This is a role for a true go-getter — someone who thrives on building relationships, winning big deals, and driving growth in a fast-evolving, high-tech environment.
 



  





**Key Responsibilities** 



* **Develop and execute a strategic sales plan for the Nordics market**
* Identify, qualify, and close new business opportunities
* **Manage the end-to-end sales cycle** 
 — from prospecting to negotiation and closing
* Build and nurture relationships with C-level executives (CIO, CFO, COO, CDO)
* **Act as a strategic advisor, aligning SPOC’s ServiceNow capabilities with clients’ business goals**
* Collaborate closely with Sales, Marketing, and Delivery teams to design compelling proposals
* Provide management with market insights, revenue forecasts, and risk assessments



  





**Skills we are looking for** 



* **15+ years of proven success in acquiring (hunting) enterprise clients in the Nordics market (mandatory)**
* A consistent track record of exceeding sales targets within IT consulting or high-tech sectors
* **An existing client network in the Nordics enterprise space** 
 (a strong advantage)
* Expertise in value-based selling and managing complex, multi-stakeholder sales cycles
* **Fluent Swedish & English communication skills** 
 (native or fluent proficiency)
* Strong technical acumen, with an ability to understand digital transformation and ServiceNow solutions
* **A true hunter mentality — proactive, persistent, and self-driven**
* Willingness to travel for client engagements across the Nordics (and occasionally within Europe)



  





**What We Offer** 



* Career growth within a rapidly scaling, high-impact ServiceNow partner
* **Full-time B2B contract with flexible remote work options**
* Competitive base salary plus uncapped commission potential
* **Direct support from ServiceNow Certified Master Architect and Certified Technical Architects to help you close opportunities**
* Collaboration with a talented team of 100+ SPOC experts across Europe
* Ongoing professional and product development
* **A truly agile, non-corporate culture** 
 where your ideas matter and your voice is heard.

title: Accigos konsultprogram HT26: Utvecklare
description:
*Har du nyligen tagit examen? Har du stort intresse för programmering, teknik, verksamhetsutveckling? Då erbjuder vi en unik möjlighet att kickstarta din tech-karriär!*
 Vad är Accigos konsultprogram?
   

  

 Accigos konsultprogram är ett treårigt traineeprogram där du får möjlighet att prova på många spännande projekt inom olika branscher. Genom interna utbildningar, coachning och kundprojekt tidigt i konsultkarriären utvecklas våra medarbetare till marknadens bästa konsulter.
   

  

 Denna annons riktar sig till dig som är intresserad av att arbeta hands-on med utveckling. Flera av våra team söker utvecklare och i ansökan ska du välja vilket område som du är mest intresserad av. Basera ditt val på intresse/ambition/erfarenhet och motivera i din ansökan.
   

  

 Du kan läsa mer om konsultprogrammet här samt mer om Accigo här.
   

  

 Vi söker dig som
   

  

* Nyligen har tagit examen från akademisk utbildning – universitetet/högskola (systemvetare/informatik/civilingenjör/datateknik eller motsvarande) eller arbetat max ett (1) år inom tech efter avslutad examen. Ej yrkesutbildning
* Har ett stort intresse för programmering, teknik och digitalisering
* Vill arbeta hands-on med utveckling
* Pratar och skriver både svenska och engelska obehindrat


 Du är en person som är initiativtagande med positiv energi, och gillar att samarbeta med andra. För att trivas på Accigo är det viktigt att du är kommunikativ, nyfiken och prestigelös.
   

  

 Till vilka områden rekryterar vi?
   

  

 Data/Business Intelligence
   

  

 Har du intresse för machine learning och avancerad analys är detta område för dig. Som utvecklare i data-teamet hjälper du företag att fatta smartare beslut med hjälp av data. Du kombinerar teknik och affärsförståelse för att skapa effektiva lösningar och driva förändring. Rollen handlar om att analysera och göra data till en strategisk tillgång. Du bygger kundanpassade data- och BI-lösningar på plattformar som DataBricks och Fabric och visualiserar data med hjälp av Power BI. I teamet hittar du hittar Data Engineers, Data Architects, AI Solution Architects, Data Scientists, visualiseringsspecialister och projektledare – alla med ett gemensamt mål: att skapa framtidens datadrivna organisationer.
   

  

 Affärssystem (ERP- Dynamics 365 Finance)
   

  

 Välj detta område om du har intresse för utveckling av affärssystem (ERP). Som utvecklare inom vårt ERP-erbjudande kommer du att arbeta med integrationer, migrering och uppgraderingar av olika tekniska miljöer (X++). Teamen har pågående projekt inom flera olika branscher som exempelvis retail, fastighet- och livsmedelsbranschen samt producerande företag. Dynamics 365-teamen arbetar nära kunderna i agila projekt för att snabbt skapa värde. Genom att koppla ihop data, människor, system och processer på samma plattform hjälper teamen våra kunder att optimera sina arbetsflöden och skapa en hållbar digital utveckling.
   

  

 CRM (Dynamics 365 CE)
   

  

 I CRM-teamet får du planera och leverera i agila utvecklingsprojekt hos våra kunder. Rollen innebär effektivisering av verksamhetsprocesser med hjälp av Dynamics 365 Customer Engagement (CRM), low code i Power Platform och utveckling i våra primära språk .NET och JavaScript. Teamet bygger CRM-lösningar som stödjer antingen kunders sälj- eller ärendehanteringsprocesser, men också helt kundunika lösningar. Integrationer är vanligt förekommande i de flesta projekten. I CRM-teamet är spektrat brett och det alla i teamet har gemensamt är ett i grunden tekniskt intresse såväl som en förståelse för kundernas verksamhetsprocesser.
   

  

**Cloud/infra (Azure)**
 I teamet Cloud & Development kommer du att göra skillnad för företag som är mitt i sin cloud-resa. Du kommer skapa integrationer och automatiserade arbetsflöden samt ta fram skräddarsydda lösningar där produkter saknas på marknaden idag. Teamet jobbar fullstack och du kommer få möjligheter att fördjupa dig i frontend, backend och infrastruktur. På frontend skapar vi intuitiva, användarvänliga gränssnitt i bleeding edge vilket idag betyder tekniker såsom React, NextJS, TypeScript, Tailwind, CSS och Angular. På backend jobbar vi just nu främst i .NET och C#, framförallt inom Azure Integration Services, men även andra custom backendlösningar. På infrastruktursidan ligger vi tungt i Azure, där du kommer toucha tekniker såsom AIS-stacken (Function/Logic Apps, Service Bus etc), olika databastekniker och AI-tjänster.
   

  

 Rekryteringsprocessen
   

  

 Processen ser ut som följer: 1) Ansökan 2) logik- och personlighetstester, 3) digital intervju, 4) case och intervju på vårt kontor i Stockholm, 5) kontraktsgenomgång.
   

  

 Case och intervju på vårt kontor kommer att ske antingen
 **onsdag 18 februari** 
 eller
 **torsdag 19 februari** 
 , boka in dessa två dagar i din kalender redan nu.
   

  

 Ansökningsperioden stänger
 **fredag 30 januari** 
 och rekryteringsprocessen beräknas avslutas i slutet av februari. Urval och återkoppling sker senast en vecka efter ansökningsperioden. Konsultprogrammet startar i augusti 2026.
   

  

 Om du har några frågor, tveka inte att höra av dig!
   

  

 Accigo är ett konsultbolag som hjälper företag och organisationer med digital affärs- och verksamhetsutveckling med tekniken som möjliggörare. För oss handlar digitalisering till 90% om människor och 10% om teknik. Det är när samspelet mellan människa och teknik fungerar som digitaliseringens fulla styrka visar sig.
   

  

 För många handlar digitalisering mest om teknik. För oss är det så otroligt mycket större. Digitalisering kan få både människor och organisationer att våga sikta högre, följa sina drömmar och öppna dörrar som de inte ens visste fanns. Och när man ser igenom tekniken och börjar skönja vilka möjligheter som gömmer sig där bakom. Då ser man att framtiden kan vara en fantastisk plats – fylld av mänsklig energi och värme – och digitalisering är inget annat än vår superkraft för att komma dit.

title: Analytics Engineer
description:
10% of Europe’s CO₂ emissions are caused by residential heating and energy bills are out of control. Aira is here to change that.
   

  

 With our intelligent Aira Heat Pump at the heart, we’re making the switch to clean energy-tech easier and more affordable. Helping Europe turn off gas and slashing energy costs one home at a time.
   

  

 Founded in 2022, and with 1200+ employees and counting, Aira is driving the clean energy revolution by providing homes with modern clean energy-tech solutions such as solar power, battery storage solutions and heat pumps. With a state-of-the-art production facility in Poland, and HQ in Stockholm, Sweden, and hubs across the UK, Germany and Italy, Aira is well on track to install clean energy-tech into 5 million homes by 2034.
   

  

**About The Role**
 Are you passionate about turning data into actionable insights? Join Aira as an Analytics Engineer and help shape the future of our Commercial Team. In this global role, you’ll sit at the intersection of business strategy and cutting-edge data technologies, building analytics capabilities that empower smarter decisions.
   

  

**What You’ll Be Doing**
* Define key metrics that guide our commercial strategies.
* Build robust data models for attribution, channel performance, and customer journey analysis.
* Partner with data engineers to transform raw data into valuable assets.
* Develop dashboards and visualization tools for marketing and business insights.
* Ensure data quality and optimize pipelines across marketing platforms.
* Contribute to best practices, frameworks, and BI infrastructure.


**What You’ll Bring To The Role**
* Strong understanding of marketing data (UTMs, attribution, ad platforms).
* Proficiency in SQL and BI tools (PowerBI preferred).
* Experience with data modelling and ETL/ELT processes (dbt, SQL, Python).
* Familiarity with cloud platforms (AWS, GCP, Azure).
* Ability to translate business needs into analytics solutions.
* Bonus: Background in software development, machine learning.


**What is in it for you?**
* Gain hands-on experience in a fast-growing scale-up, with a supportive and inclusive culture, and career advancement opportunities.
* Collaborate with diverse teams across international markets and launch products globally.
* Develop and grow personally and professionally in an entrepreneurial-minded environment.
* Thrive in a dynamic, solution-oriented culture, tackling challenges and driving meaningful solutions that make a positive impact on the world.
* Influence the company's success, with a visible impact on product development and market growth.
* Enjoy our brand-new office at Norra Stationsgatan 93 in Stockholm. Conveniently located near public transport, with Sankt Eriksplan and Odenplan stations just a few minutes walk away.


 At Aira, we champion next-generation energy as well as diversity and inclusion. We firmly believe that a diverse workforce fosters innovation and creativity, enhancing our ability to serve customers and communities effectively. We welcome individuals from all backgrounds, cultures and perspectives to join our team. Our commitment is to uphold equality and inclusivity, fostering a collaborative environment where everyone can thrive and contribute to a better future for our people and the planet.

title: Channel Account Executive - Nordics
description:
**Your work days are brighter here.**
 We’re obsessed with making hard work pay off, for our people, our customers, and the world around us. As a Fortune 500 company and a leading AI platform for managing people, money, and agents, we’re shaping the future of work so teams can reach their potential and focus on what matters most. The minute you join, you’ll feel it. Not just in the products we build, but in how we show up for each other. Our culture is rooted in integrity, empathy, and shared enthusiasm. We’re in this together, tackling big challenges with bold ideas and genuine care. We look for curious minds and courageous collaborators who bring sun-drenched optimism and drive. Whether you're building smarter solutions, supporting customers, or creating a space where everyone belongs, you’ll do meaningful work with Workmates who’ve got your back. In return, we’ll give you the trust to take risks, the tools to grow, the skills to develop and the support of a company invested in you for the long haul. So, if you want to inspire a brighter work day for everyone, including yourself, you’ve found a match in Workday, and we hope to be a match for you too.
   

  

**About The Team**
 Workmates pride themselves on winning while having fun! That means supporting each other while driving accountability for amazing results and performance. This team is no different. Everything we do inspires a brighter work day for all. The Enterprise Sales team at Workday helps the company to continue to grow by balancing integrity and innovation, ensuring Workmates have the environment to bring their best self, and get better by pushing and developing themselves and the Workmates around them.
   

  

**About The Role**
 The Channel Account Executive (CAE) is a critical, highly strategic sales role responsible for managing and growing the company's relationships with third-party partners—including
 **Value Added Resellers (VARs)** 
 —to drive indirect revenue growth for our enterprise software solutions. This role functions as the primary link between our organization and the partner ecosystem, requiring a blend of sales acumen, strategic relationship management, and deep product knowledge.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Partner Strategy and Business Planning (The Strategic View)
* Develop and Execute Joint Business Plans: Create, maintain, and execute annual and quarterly business plans (QBPs) with top-tier partners, including defined revenue targets, marketing activities, training schedules, and pipeline generation goals.
* Recruitment and Onboarding: Actively identify, recruit, and onboard new partners who align with geographic, industry, and technical gaps in the existing channel network to expand market reach.
* Performance Management: Lead the overall performance of the assigned partner portfolio, regularly supervising and reporting on partner sales activity, pipeline health, and key performance indicators (KPIs).
* Opportunity Management and Execution (The Sales Driver)
* Enablement and Training: Work with Value Added Reseller resources to deliver comprehensive sales, product, and technical training to customers, ensuring they are fully equipped to position and sell Workday.
* Opportunity Management: Sell to customers through Value Added Resellers, working to register, qualify, and sell large, complex enterprise opportunities through the entire sales cycle.
* Forecasting and Pipeline: Maintain a consistent and accurate sales forecast for all VAR business within the assigned territory.
* Relationship Management and Advocacy (The Trusted Advisor)
* Cultivate Executive Relationships: Build and maintain strong, trusted relationships with executive leadership, sales management, and key stakeholders within the partner organizations.
* Conflict Resolution: Proactively manage channel conflict by establishing clear rules of engagement and facilitating resolution between partners and the direct sales organization to create a smooth customer experience.
* Partner Advocacy: Serve as the "voice of the partner" internally, communicating partner needs and market feedback to internal teams such as Field Sales, Product Management, Marketing, and Customer Success.


**About You**
**Basic Qualifications**
* Experience: [5+] years of demonstrable success in channel sales, partner management, or business development within the enterprise software, SaaS, or technology sector.
* Industry Knowledge: Proven ability to understand and articulate the business value of complex enterprise software solutions (e.g., Cloud ERP, Analytics, Industry-specific SaaS).
* Sales Acumen: Verifiable track record of meeting or exceeding multi-million dollar annual sales or channel revenue quotas.
* Education: Bachelor's degree in Business, Marketing, or a related field; a technical degree or equivalent practical experience is a plus.
* Tool Proficiency: Expertise in utilizing CRM software (e.g., Salesforce, Dynamics) for pipeline management, forecasting, and reporting
* Communication: Excellent verbal and written language skills in Swedish and English


**Additional Qualifications:**
* Strong executive presence and presentation skills; comfortable engaging with C-level audiences.
* Deep understanding of different partner business models (VAR, SI, MSP, OEM, Distributor) and how to drive profitability for each.
* Proven track record in working effectively in a highly matrixed organization, getting results through influence rather than direct authority.
* Willingness and ability to travel up to [75%] within the assigned territory.


**Our Offer**
* Competitive remuneration, restricted stock units & an ESPP
* Health insurance for employees and their families, pension plan & more
* Flexible working hours and work from home option
* A powerful product, named as a leader by Gartner for Cloud HCM Suites, Cloud Core Financial Management Suites and Cloud Financial Planning and Analysis
* Structured employee onboarding & Workday sales academy to ensure a quick and successful ramp up
* Team events, employee assistance program, perks/discounts offerings, free fresh fruit & snacks in our office locations and mor


**Our Approach to Flexible Work**
 With Flex Work, we’re combining the best of both worlds: in-person time and remote. Our approach enables our teams to deepen connections, maintain a strong community, and do their best work. We know that flexibility can take shape in many ways, so rather than a number of required days in-office each week, we simply
 **spend at least half (50%) of our time each quarter in the office or in the field** 
 with our customers, prospects, and partners (depending on role). This means you'll have the freedom to create a flexible schedule that caters to your business, team, and personal needs, while being intentional to make the most of time spent together. Those in our remote "home office" roles also have the opportunity to come together in our offices for important moments that matter.
   

  

 At Workday, we are committed to providing an accessible and inclusive hiring experience where all candidates can fully demonstrate their skills. If you require assistance or an accommodation at any point, please email accommodations@workday.com.
   

  

**Are you being referred to one of our roles? If so, ask your connection at Workday about our Employee Referral process!**
 At Workday, we value our candidates’ privacy and data security. Workday will never ask candidates to apply to jobs through websites that are not Workday Careers.
   

  

 Please be aware of sites that may ask for you to input your data in connection with a job posting that appears to be from Workday but is not.
   

  

 In addition, Workday will never ask candidates to pay a recruiting fee, or pay for consulting or coaching services, in order to apply for a job at Workday.
   

  

 ,

title: Ekonomiansvarig till SaaS-bolag
description:
Nu har du chansen att få komma till ett spännande SaaS-bolag med dynamisk kultur och många möjligheter. Vill du ta ett helhetsansvar för ekonomifunktionen och arbeta både högt och lågt med allt från fakturering till presentation av siffror till styrelse och ledning.
 



  





 Detta är start omgående och tänkt att övergå i en anställning hos vår kund!
 



  





**Huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifter** 




  





 Rollen som ekonomiansvarig innebär att ta ansvar för bolagets finansiella avdelning. Arbetet innefattar både högt och lågt samt rapportering, utveckling och implementering av ekonomiska strategier för att stödja företagets tillväxt.
 



  





 Du får en bred och operativ roll där du ansvarar för hela ekonomifunktionen och blir en viktig sparringpartner till VD.
 



  





 • Hantering av outsourcade löner och redovisning till byrå.
 



 • Utveckling och implementering av ekonomiska strategier.
 



 • Förberedelse och hantering av investerarrundor.
 



  





**Lämplig bakgrund** 




  





 • Erfarenhet av att arbeta i ett litet bolag med komplexa flöden.
 



 • Stark bakgrund inom redovisning och rapportering.
 



 • Erfarenhet från SaaS-branschen.
 



 • Erfarenhet av att sitta i ledningsgrupp och delta på styrelsemöten.
 



 • Gedigen ekonomisk kompetens och förmåga att agera som sparringpartner till VD
 



  





**Ansökan** 




  





 För mer information om tjänsten är du välkommen att kontakta ansvarig Konsultchef Emma Hultberg på 0766471641 Vi intervjuar löpande och tjänsten kan komma att tillsättas innan ansökningstiden har gått ut. Sista ansökningsdag är 2026-02-01
 



  





 Varmt välkommen med din ansökan!

title: Assembly Test and Verification Engineer
description:
Role description
  
We are looking for an Assembly Test and Verification Engineer to assemble, integrate, and verify prototypes and products for advanced mechatronic systems. You will be involved across the product lifecycle—from early design phases through testing and release—working closely with design, quality, and production stakeholders.
  
This assignment suits someone who enjoys hands-on engineering, structured testing, and cross-functional collaboration.
  
  

Responsibilities
  
Assemble and integrate prototypes and products, combining mechanical, pneumatic, electrical, and software components
  
Execute safety, functional, and performance testing at component and system level
  
Support test/verification activities from early development through release readiness
  
Contribute to test processes, test documentation, and continuous improvement of lab ways of working
  
Troubleshoot physical hardware issues and support root-cause investigations
  
Support lab operations related to rapid prototyping and additive manufacturing activities
  
Mentor and support other engineers within the lab/test environment
  
  

Requirements
  
Master’s degree in Engineering (or other relevant academic background)
  
Minimum 5 years of experience within Assembly Test and Verification
  
Broad technical understanding of mechatronic systems
  
Experience assembling and testing equipment where multiple disciplines are integrated (mechanical, electrical, software)
  
Strong problem-solving and hands-on troubleshooting skills for physical hardware
  
Ability to thrive in early-stage development and navigate a large, complex organization
  
Team-oriented mindset and willingness to learn new techniques and working methods
  
Excellent communication skills in English
  
  

Meritorious
  
Experience working in prototype or lab environments
  
Experience contributing to improvements of test processes and lab operations
  
Experience mentoring or supporting other engineers
  
  

Start / Duration
  
**Start:** 2026-02-02
  
**Duration:** Until 2026-08-01
  
Location
  
Stockholm (hybrid)
  
  

About Rasulson Consulting
  
Rasulson Consulting is a specialized staffing and recruitment firm within the IT sector. We partner with established technology companies as well as innovative startups to offer attractive career opportunities for professionals looking to grow within digital development and IT. With our strong technical expertise and extensive network, we effectively match the right consultant with the right assignment. At Rasulson Consulting, you will receive personalized guidance, ongoing feedback, and the opportunity to take the next step in your career.

title: Rock Mechanics Engineer
description:
locations
Boliden
time type
Full time
posted on
Posted Today
time left to apply
End Date: February 16, 2026 (20 days left to apply)
job requisition id
JOB\_013811
Boliden is a high-tech metals company with its own mines and smelters that works long-term to guarantee society's access to base and precious metals. For a century, our work has been part of the value chains that have shaped modern society. At Boliden, we know that the metals we mine and make available will continue to play a crucial role in the future – what matters is how we produce them. Become a part of us and drive change for generations to come.
Your opportunity
As a Rock Mechanics Engineer within Boliden’s Mine Staff, you will have a role in ensuring safe and efficient mining operations across our sites. This position is based at our Boliden office and primarily supports Boliden area and the Kristineberg mine, with potential expansion to other mines. Regular, weekly travel to mining sites will be part of your work.
Who you will work with
You will be part of a dedicated Rock Mechanics team within the Mine Staff organization, collaborating closely with mine planning engineers, geology departments, production technology specialists and other technical service departments. Your work will also involve interaction with consultants and other technical experts across Boliden’s operations. Although the team is geographically distributed, you will have regular opportunities for knowledge sharing and joint problem-solving in cross-functional projects. The rock mechanics team is composed of numerous geotechnical engineers, seniors and specialist from various nationalities which instils a unique, welcoming culture that caters for a thriving environment.
What you will do* Conduct geotechnical assessments and stability analyses for underground mining areas
* Provide operational, on-site support to the technical service department in geotechnical matters
* Monitor and evaluate ground conditions and implement appropriate rock support measures
* Collect geotechnical data underground and maintain geotechnical database
* Assist with numerical stress modelling to deliver and establish safe and efficient mine plans
* Provide geotechnical support in short-term mine and budget design to LOMP risk assessments
* Propose and oversee ground support in line with existing standard operating procedures and ground control management plans
* Collaborate closely with mine planning, production teams, and external consultants
* Participate in R&D projects and contribute to improving rock mechanics processes within the department and at site
* Provide technical advice and facilitate cross-functional cooperation within the organization
* Conduct geotechnical core logging in line with updating and maintaining geotechnical data models


What you bring
If this opportunity excites you and you feel ready to take on this role, we welcome your application. We believe you have/are:* Education: BSc or higher in Mining Engineering, Rock Mechanics, Civil Engineering with Specialism in Mining, or Geotechnical Engineering
* Experience: Previous experience in hard rock underground mining, preferably base metals
* Skills: Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, ability to explain complex concepts clearly and proficiency in relevant software. Comfortable working individually and in teams closely with others, discussing technical topics with both engineers and non‑engineers and contributing to joint decisions in a team environment.
* Languages: Proficiency in English and Swedish, or willingness and ability to learn Swedish quickly
* Driver’s License: Valid B-class license


It’s an advantage if you have experience in project work, facilitating collaboration and working in dynamic environments with changing priorities.
Why work with us
At Boliden, we believe in promoting a workplace where care, courage, and responsibility are central to everything we do. We offer a workplace where we believe in collaboration and where what you contribute will have a direct impact on future generations. We are a company made up of responsible and creative people all working towards the same vision; to become the most sustainable and respected metal supplier in the world.
Apply today to be part of something truly meaningful!
At Boliden, diversity and inclusion are drivers of innovation. We know that different perspectives and experiences strengthen us and help us stay at the forefront of an important and exciting industry. Therefore, we encourage applications from people with diverse backgrounds and viewpoints. Together, we have built a workplace where everyone can feel safe and inspired to reach their full potential.  

Want to know more about the position? Contact hiring manager Tim-Oliver Latta at Tim-Oliver.Latta@boliden.com. Questions about the application are answered by Talent Acquisition Partner Terese Lindholm at terese.lindholm@boliden.com. For union information contact Mats Lindblom, SACO, +46 73 350 04 19, Andreas Mårtensson, Unionen, +46 70 541 83 93 or Peter Markström, Ledarna, +46 910 77 40 09.
Submit your application by: Sunday 15 February 2026
Please submit your application to us as soon as possible, selection may take place on an ongoing basis. As part of Boliden’s commitment to quality recruitment and systematic safety efforts, background and health checks are included in our recruitment processes.*If you are a representative of a recruiting agency, please refrain from contacting us regarding this advertisement. We appreciate your understanding.*
-
Important! If you are a current employee within Boliden you shouldn't complete the application at this site, please log on to your Workday account

title: Senior QA and Test Automation Engineer
description:
Going where no tech has gone before... into the wild!
  
At Natlink, we believe technology can deepen rather than replace our connection to nature. If you want to build technology that connects people with nature, this is your chance.
  
Through our brands WeHunt, Tracker, and Burrel, we empower nearly a million hunters and outdoor enthusiasts across Europe with smarter tools that enhance safety, strengthen community, and make outdoor experiences more engaging.
  
We build that future by combining innovation, sustainability, and respect for wildlife with the joys of being in nature. Working at Natlink means shaping both hardware and software products that matter while working with passionate colleagues.
  
Senior QA and Test Automation Engineer
  
About the job
  
We're seeking a talented QA and Test Automation Engineer to join our team and help us maintain our high standards in creating software that enhances outdoor experiences for enthusiasts around the world.
  
As a QA and Test Automation Engineer, you will play a critical role in ensuring the quality and reliability of our software products. You will set quality standards, and develop and execute comprehensive test plans to identify issues and prevent defects in our software. You will also be responsible for designing, implementing, and maintaining test automation frameworks to streamline our testing processes.
  
  

**Responsibilities:**  

Define and implement quality assurance processes and best practices.
  
Develop and execute test plans, test cases, and test scripts for manual and automated testing.
  
Create, maintain, and enhance test automation frameworks using tools like Selenium, Appium, or similar.
  
Collaborate with developers and product managers to understand requirements and ensure comprehensive test coverage.
  
  

**Requirements:**  

Proven experience in software quality assurance and test automation.
  
Strong knowledge of QA methodologies, tools, and processes.
  
Proficiency in test automation using tools like Selenium, Appium, or similar.
  
Experience with programming languages like Java, Python, or C# for test automation.
  
Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
  
Excellent communication and collaboration abilities.
  
Knowledge of CI/CD pipelines and tools is a plus.
  
Perform functional, regression, integration, and performance testing.
  
Identify and report defects, track issues, and verify bug fixes.
  
Continuously improve testing processes and methodologies.
  
Provide clear and concise test status reports to stakeholders.
  
Stay up-to-date with industry trends and best practices in QA and test automation.
  
  

**What We Offer:**  

Competitive salary and performance-based bonuses.
  
Opportunities for professional growth and development.
  
A collaborative and innovative work environment
  
  

Öppen för alla
  
Vi fokuserar på din kompetens, inte dina övriga förutsättningar. Vi är öppna för att anpassa rollen eller arbetsplatsen efter dina behov.

title: Test Equipment Engineer
description:

title: Mechanical Integrity Engineer
description:
**A Snapshot of Your Day**


Join our Turbine Mechanical Integrity team as an Mechanical Integrity Engineer. We offer a stimulating work environment, abundant opportunities for professional development, and the chance to contribute to our company’s success.



In this role, you will enhance our understanding of the lifing behavior of components and systems in the turbine (downstream of the compressor and the combustor) by executing lifing work related to non-conformities in manufactured parts, field issues in operating gas turbines, and new developments. A typical analysis will start with stress/thermo-mechanical analysis as the basis for low cycle fatigue, creep, crack growth, and oxidation assessments. You will collaborate with project teams that include senior MI engineers, designers, heat transfer engineers, and CFD engineers. Your primary workplace will be our office in Finspång, with occasional remote work options.



**How You’ll Make an Impact**

* Conduct stress and lifetime assessments using finite element analysis and other numerical methods under guidance.
* Prepare comprehensive structural integrity reports documenting your FE calculations.
* Contribute to the development and enhancement of lifing methodologies, tools and procedures.
* Collaborate with multidisciplinary teams to gather essential data and inputs for accurate assessments and calculations.


**What You Bring**


* MSc Mechanical Engineering or related field.
* Basic knowledge of structural/FEM analysis for lifing calculations, with an understanding of relevant principles and methodologies.
* Familiarity with software tools such as ABAQUS and HyperWorks.
* Proficiency in English, both verbal and written.


**About the Team**



You will be part of an experienced team with different backgrounds and responsibilities. We strive to support each other and build a strong technical knowledge within the team. We are committed to developing long-term competencies and seek individuals who are looking to grow with us.



Our **Gas Services division** offers Low-emission power generation through service and decarbonization. Zero or low emission power generation and all gas turbines under one roof, steam turbines and generators. Decarbonization opportunities through service offerings, modernization, and digitalization of the fleet.

  


We can offer you employment benefits such as: reduction of working hours, advance vacation, health care allowance and an eventual possibility to a flexible working place.

  

**Who is Siemens Energy?**



At Siemens Energy, we are more than just an energy technology company. With ~100,000 dedicated employees in more than 90 countries, we develop the energy systems of the future, ensuring that the growing energy demand of the global community is met reliably and sustainably. The technologies created in our research departments and factories drive the energy transition and provide the base for one sixth of the world's electricity generation.

  


Our global team is committed to making sustainable, reliable, and affordable energy a reality by pushing the boundaries of what is possible. We uphold a 150-year legacy of innovation that encourages our search for people who will support our focus on decarbonization, new technologies, and energy transformation.

  


Find out how you can make a difference at Siemens Energy: https://www.siemens-energy.com/employeevideo

  

**Our Commitment to Diversity**



Lucky for us, we are not all the same. Through diversity, we generate power. We run on inclusion and our combined creative energy is fueled by over 130 nationalities. Siemens Energy celebrates character – no matter what ethnic background, gender, age, religion, identity, or disability. We energize society, all of society, and we do not discriminate based on our differences.

  

**Application**



Don’t hesitate – apply via https://jobs.siemens-energy.com/en\_US/jobs or https://siemensenergy.avature.net/internalcareers , id nr 284104 not later than 2026-02-09

  


Ongoing selection is applied, the role might be filled before last application date.



For questions about the role, please contact the recruiting manager Malin Leijon Lind on malin.leijon\_lind@siemens-energy.com



For questions about the recruitment process please contact the responsible recruiter Johanna Sangrud on Johanna.sangrud@siemens-energy.com



We refrain from all contact with staffing and recruitment companies, or advertising brokers.

  


Location: Finspång

  

**Trade Union Representatives:**  

Unionen, unionen.finspang.se@siemens-energy.com  

Sveriges Ingenjörer & SACO, asi.se@siemens-energy.com
  

Ledarna, Anders Fors, anders.fors@siemens-energy.com
  

IF Metall, Mikael Malmgren, mikael.malmgren@siemens-energy.com

  

  

**#LI-JS6**
company_description: At Siemens Energy, we are more than just an energy technology company. We meet the growing energy demand across 90+ countries while ensuring our climate is protected.

title: Java Backend Software Engineer (Stockholm)
description:
**Join Polystar | Elisa Industriq: Shape the Future of Telecom**
 At Polystar, we are seeking a hands‑on software developer who will turn product requirements into powerful features. You will build and own Java services in complex, distributed systems and deliver features that process, enrich, store and visualize telco data in real time. You will also help evolve our Kubernetes‑based platform with a focus on reliability, security, and observability.
   

  

**What We're Looking For**
* Strong experience with Java (back-end or full-stack) and distributed systems.
* Kubernetes: Experience with containerization, production ops, and security.
* Bonus points: Curiosity to learn telecom signaling, protocols, and mobile networks. Experience in AI/ML assisted coding tools, such as Github Copilot.
* Strong collaboration skills: Proactiveness and willingness to take initiative, own decisions and follow through.
* Tech Enthusiast: Thrive in a creative, problem-solving, high-tech environment, adaptive to changing requirements and deadlines.
* Customer delivery mindset: Comfortable troubleshooting and deploying remotely in customer environments.


**Why Polystar?**
* Global Impact: Trusted by 100+ telecom operators in 55 countries, your code helps optimize networks for millions of people worldwide.
* Engaging Technical Challenges: Work with software that processes massive data volumes in real time.
* Collaborative Culture: Supportive team where knowledge-sharing is second nature.
* Learning & Growth: We help you master our technical scope and support your career development.
* Hybrid & Flexible Work: Balance office and remote work in a way that suits you (on average 3 days per week).


**Sounds interesting? Apply today and let’s have a chat over a cup of coffee!**
 Good to note: The selected will go through a background check.

title: Test Engineer
description:
Marketnode is Asia-Pacific’s trusted blockchain-powered financial market infrastructure (FMI) backed by HSBC, SGX Group and Temasek. We believe in the power of programmable assets and believe traditional financial instruments can be originated, traded and served better leveraging blockchain technologies. Our current product focus is funds, credit and structured products with a view to expand these offerings in-line with market demands.
   

  

 Having recently closed our Series A investment with major financial institutions such as HSBC, Marketnode is now well positioned for it’s next growth phase and is looking for a Test Engineer leading overall delivery efforts for our platform and data services offerings.
   

  

 The role is responsible for planning, designing, executing, and maintaining test activities to ensure product quality across functional and integrated systems.
   

  

 This role involves collaborating closely with developers, business analysts, and other QA team members to identify issues early, improve test coverage, and contribute to continuous improvement of testing processes and automation practices.
   

  

 If you are passionate about and interested in the nexus between fintech and capital markets, we would like to talk to you.
 **The role is based in India and reports to the Lead QA Engineer.**
**Key Responsibilities**
* user stories, requirements, and design documents to define comprehensive test scenarios.
* Design, develop, and execute manual and automated test cases for functional, regression, and integration testing.
* Develop and maintain automation scripts (Selenium, Cypress, Playwright, etc.).
* Perform API and integration testing.
* Identify, document, and track bugs using issue tracking tools.
* Collaborate with developers and product teams to ensure timely bug resolution.
* Support non-functional testing (e.g., performance, security, usability) as required
* Contribute to QA process improvements and maintain test documentation, including test plans, test strategy updates, and test reports.


**Qualifications**
* Experience:3+ years of experience in engineering / software quality assurance, with 2+ in automation.
* Have domain knowledge for Blockchain or Digital Asset
* Technical Skills:Skilled in at least one programming/scripting language (Java, JavaScript, etc.).
* Knowledge of CI/CD tools, bug tracking systems, and QA methodologies.
* Detail-oriented, analytical, and proactive
* Education:Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field, or equivalent experience.

title: Web3 Engineer
description:
Marketnode is a digital market infrastructure (DMI) operator backed by Euroclear, HSBC, SGX Group and Temasek. We believe in the power of programmable assets and that traditional financial instruments will be originated, transacted and served better leveraging emerging technologies such as blockchain. Our approach to building market infrastructure is one of partnership with the industry and in 2024 have successfully launched our first market-wide platform for funds, with credit and structured products to follow 2025 onwards.
   

  

**At Marketnode, Our DMI Suite Covers The Following**
* Data services: AI powered structured data and extraction tools
* Funds & transaction management: operating Fundnode, a funds transaction management and settlement platform
* Digital Assets: multi-asset tokenization, record keeping and asset servicing


 Having recently closed our Series A investment with major financial institutions such as HSBC and Euroclear, Marketnode is now well positioned for it’s next growth phase. We are seeking a highly motivated Java Engineer.
   

  

 If you are interested in the nexus between fintech and capital markets, we would like to talk to you.
 **The role is based in Bangalore, India.**
**What You'll Do**
* Design and implement features on our Web3 platforms
* Develop and test secure smart contracts
* Maintain high efficiency of connectivity and security in Fireblocks
* Contribute to architecture design
* Continually improve developer experience on our codebases to increase efficiency
* Collaborate on product shaping and delivery
* Uphold a strong testing and documentation culture

**Job Requirements**
* 5+ Years Experience with Core Technology Stack

**Nice to Have**
